div.em: Current conditions as of 24 Apr 08:54 am CDT

div.div: A 50 percent chance of showers. Cloudy, with a high near 63. North wind 8 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.
A 20 percent chance of showers before 11pm. Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming mostly clear, with a low around 42. North wind 5 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

A slight chance of showers between 8am and 2pm, then a slight chance of showers and thunderstorms after 2pm. Mostly sunny, with a high near 68. North northwest wind 5 to 11 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

div.em: Current conditions as of 24 Apr 08:54 am CDT

div.div: A 50 percent chance of showers. Cloudy, with a high near 63. North wind 8 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.
A 20 percent chance of showers before 11pm. Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming mostly clear, with a low around 42. North wind 5 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

A slight chance of showers between 8am and 2pm, then a slight chance of showers and thunderstorms after 2pm. Mostly sunny, with a high near 68. North northwest wind 5 to 11 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

a.aria-label: Read more about Spread Joy!

div.p: Please review the available slots below and click on the button to sign up. We will have all plant sale orders pre-packaged. Park your vehicle in the north parking lot behind the school. We will approach each car to see what order(s) you are picking up and bring them to you. Thank you for your patience and support!
**Please list ALL the orders you will be picking up by April 30 in the appropriate question/answer section to help us with the organization of pre-packing.**

p.a: Raymond Central Elementary @ Valparaiso, 406 East Third Street, Valparaiso, Nebraska 68065

a.aria-label: Read more about RC Plant Sale Pick-up 2020

h3.a: Bright Lights Summer Volunteer Opportunity for Youth

a.aria-label: Read more about Bright Lights Summer Volunteer Opportunity for Youth

div.p: Raymond Central Schools is working to help make our community strong. If you are experiencing stress, whether that be related to food insecurity, paying bills, or finding support systems, please complete the online form. We will do our best, with the assistance of community navigators, to connect your family to local and state resources. The link to the survey can be found on the Raymond Central website under COVID-19 Remote Learning Resources. The survey will close on May 1, 2020.

a.aria-label: Read more about Need Assistance Questionnaire
Read more about Spreading Joy

div.p: Please complete this survey if your student(s) is interested in eating a school-supplied lunch while the district is closed due to the spread of COVID-19. Our food service department plans to prepare lunch and deliver them to our local communities for pickup. These meals are being offered free of charge, however, we need to determine total numbers and locations. Please contact the District Office (402-785-2615 or email crieck@rcentral.org) with any questions.

If you receive the answering machine please leave your name, your child's name, email contact, phone number, how many lunches you are requesting, and the best location for pickup (Ceresco Elementary, Valparaiso Elementary, JR/SR High School, Public Space in Raymond (Park), Public Space in Davey (Post Office), or Other)

a.aria-label: Read more about Raymond Central School Closure Lunch
Read more about Nebraska Family Helpline

h3.a: RC Before & After School Program Registration Now Open

a.aria-label: Read more about RC Before & After School Program Registration Now Open

div.p: The University of Nebraska Extension has been contracted by the Department of Health and Human Services to conduct a community health analysis. Our aim is to gather information from residents of Saunders and surrounding counties, in an effort to uncover the barriers and challenges experienced in regards to accessing health care services. Of particular interest is diabetes management and education. Please use the link included at the bottom of the attached flyer or contact Nebraska Extension at 402.727.2775 to register for any and all community meetings. Your input is vitally important as we move forward in expanding and improving upon health services available in Saunders County.

a.aria-label: Read more about Community Health Analysis

li.title: Bright Lights Summer Volunteer Opportunity for Youth
RC Before & After School Program Registration Now Open

div.script: ;(function($) {/* Add the "active" class to the first item in the carousel */$('#socs-feature-carousel .item:first, #socs-feature-carousel .carousel-indicators > li:first').addClass('active'); })(jQuery);

div.p: We will provide a quality education as the cooperative responsibility of students, staff, parents, and community. We will provide a safe learning environment where all individuals are treated with dignity and respect. We will encourage life-long learning and responsible citizenship. We will empower students to be problem solvers and independent learners. We will provide each student with the opportunity to learn and achieve success. We will meet the needs of individual students through a variety of approaches to learning. We will use available time and resources to stay on top of current educational practices We will continuously evaluate, update and assess our districts goals.

a.aria-label: Read more about Raymond Central Values
